page.title: 08EMPLOYMENT IN EDGEFIELD
page.content: Agriculture is no longer a major source of employment in Edgefield: a large farm such as Edgefield Hall only employs the farmer's own son. Most of the farms seem to be mainly family concerns, as are the different forms of self-employment, such as the Edgefield Pottery - a man and wife team, and the Edgefield Gallery - run by the artist, with extra help during the tourist season. There is a breeder of miniature greyhounds, an owner of boarding kennels who is also a dog- breeder, a wood worker who makes doors and windows, a printer, a garage-owner a shopkeeper who also runs the Post Office, a publican, and a welder. In the summer tourism plays its part: there are caravan sites and a few holiday cottages. But there are few jobs for the young who must go outside the village and have no transport.
